poem:
### Building Bridges

In the din of Parliament—  
broken cobblestones, voices  
threaded through fog—  
a promise rebuilt  
brick upon anxious brick,  
the scaffold of hope  
rises,  
casting shadows  
of the past into  
distant whispers.  
We are mortar and  
mind, dreaming  
beyond day's grumble,  
a single stitch  
in history's  
tapestry.
